A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
The movie was enjoyable on a very surface level.
The start\, really good\, the end\, really good.
The middle part\, almost ruins the entire movie.

Not to mention that there were huge plot holes that\, once the credits roll and you leave the theater\, that glow of enjoyment just 'drains' after you start thinking "why couldn't they do *blank due to not wanting to give away spoilers* sooner with *spoilers*"
"Why did "X" character keep "X" secret because there was no reason"
It was a flashy movie\, but all but one or two characters actually has 'depth' given to them\, all the others were very shallow and token.  There's even one character that takes up a large portion of the movie but had so little depth\, if you changed 'one' thing about the movie\, this character could have been removed and made the movie better and shorter.

The only reason I watched this movie was because it had "Star Wars" written on it\, and if you removed that and judged it from it's own merits\, it wouldn't have a leg to stand on.
